summary:
A quick intro; my name is Ahmad Elhusseinie and I am a demand manager at the ministry of finance - tax office. As a demand manager I bring demand and supply together between the tax office (management level) and potential suppliers. This is a generic role where a “T profile” is required; helicopter view  and understanding details when needed. I do requirements management as well as advisory on an executive level and supplier management. 

I am experienced with projects as well as operations. “Advisory” and “Management” might best describe my expertise. During my work I enjoy stakeholders management (often in a political environment) to find the “why”, impact, consequences and create an understanding of complex topics. I am perceived to be a generalist, self-starter and critical thinker. In the past I worked in different sectors; private as well as public and SME as well as large enterprises. Furthermore, I speak several languages and enjoy inclusive intercultural dialogue and understanding. 

I give high importance to continuous self development; currently I am studying/researching to obtain my PhD degree at the Leiden University next to having a full-time job.

Some keywords:

• Advisory (consulting lifecycle, (IT) policy advisory, sourcing strategy, IT strategy, governance & translating business needs to IT solutions)
• Requirements management (stakeholder management, user stories and MoSCoW)	
• Service Delivery (ITIL V3 certified, Stakeholder management, Escalation management, 
• Contract management, Exit- and retransition plans, SLA, DAP/OLA)
• Project management (change management, software implementation and other projects, communication plans, Agile/SCRUM,  Prince2 certified, waterfall)
• Enterprise Architecture (TOGAF 9, IT policy and principles)	
• Process management (applying Lean Six Sigma; supply chain management, optimising links within chains)
• Quality management (TPI maturity and TMap NEXT certified)
• "Getting things done" mentality
• Strong communication- and presentation skills - story telling
• Internationally oriented and culturally sensitive: lived in different countries
• Able to adapt fast to different situations and changing environments
• I speak different languages (Dutch, English, Arabic fluent - German, Farsi, Chinese basic)

school.name: HU University of Applied Sciences Utrecht (Hogeschool Utrecht)

projects.title: Service & Contract Management at Zuyderland Medisch Centrum
projects.description:
Zuyderland (formerly Atrium-Orbis) is a hospital based in the most southern province in the Netherlands. I wrote a Retransitieplan as intermediary between KPN and Zuyderland. Goal of the document was to record the strategy as well as activities and deliverables in case of a retransition of services. The report included chapters about strategy, financials, agreements, etc. During the assignment I created a draft framework for the Retransitieplan and discussed the framework with the client. My client was the procurement director as well as the legal director at Zuyderland. I conducted interviews with stakeholders at KPN in order to fulfil requirements. The Retransitieplan was accepted by the client director from KPN as well as my stakeholders at Zuyderland. Both KPN and the Zuyderland were satisfied with the result. I wrote a similar report at Siza, a healthcare institution. 

At Zuyderland I designed Service Level Agreement documents based on ITIL V3. I was in the lead for this project, as two colleagues wrote the documents. My role was to review/quality control and client interaction. I interacted with stakeholders at KPN as well as Zuyderland.

projects.title: Consultant at Tweede Kamer der Staten-Generaal
projects.description: Together with a team of 4 consultants I conducted an advisory assignment. During this assignment we analysed "Tweede Kamer"'s change proces by conducting interviews. I was involved in the project planning phase, analysis phase, report-writing phase and review phase. I mainly looked at the customer's problem from a process- and governance viewpoint. Tweede Kamer was satisfied with the results and implemented several recommendations.

projects.title: Process- and Change Consultant at KPN Consulting
projects.description:
The so called "Funnel to Cash" process is an internal process from the beginning of the sales funnel all the way until billing. I helped improving this process, by means of Lean Six Sigma tools. I was mainly involved in change management. This means that I was involved in:

- writing a communication plan: the communication plan included a communication strategy, stakeholder analysis, planning, etc.
- communicating measures to realise a culture change (blogs, workshops, etc.).
- gaining insight in the overall process: created process flows and gained insight in SIPOC (suppliers, input, process, output, customer).
- did a workshop for different stakeholder (around 80 people, including the CEO and senior management) to communicate the impact of the current problems in the process.
- implemented means of communication to stimulate process awareness (to help stakeholders realise their position in the chain/process and their impact of other parts of the process).

contributors.headline: Senior Manager Data Strategy & Data Management

projects.title: Process Consultant at KPN
projects.description:
I did a project at the mother organisation of KPN Consulting: KPN. KPN has several customer support maintenance teams.These customer teams work by means of computer hard- and software. I guided the process for setting up Lifecycle Management. I delivered:

- two workshops to gain insight in requirements for the lifecycle.
- set the goal and scope for Lifecycle Management.
- created a SIPOC according the the Lean Six Sigma methodology.
- created swim lanes which illustrated the process.
- advised KPN on the implementation of the process according to Lean Six Sigma (L6S).

projects.title: Consulting & requirement management at ProRail
projects.description:
ProRail is a customer of KPN Consulting. •	ProRail is the organisation that is responsible for all railway infrastructure in the Netherlands. ProRail required to implement modern IT infrastructure to monitor the rail. I conducted workshops with all relevant stakeholders in order to write requirements. Requirements were based on the agile methodology (user stories). After that I led a workshop in order to prioritise the requirements. I  created a card game based on MoSCoW to prioritise requirements. I conducted a project at ProRail with regards to requirements management. During the project I:

- guided two workshops with different stakeholders to formulate high level requirements.
- Prioritised requirements as part of the second workshop, by using the MoSCoW method. I developed a card game as a means to stimulate discussions. 

End result: prioritised requirements for monitoring ProRail's network infrastructure. This project is highly important, due to its national impact on rail systems and train service levels (for ProRail's customer: NS).

projects.title: Training portfolio at KPN
projects.description: Analyse current and create new training portfolio that matches the new mission of KPN Consulting: "Your guide in the new world"

contributors.headline: Senior adviseur organisatieontwikkeling | L&D | Grip op je bedrijfscultuur

projects.title: Enterprise Architecture Consultant at Gemeente Zaanstad
projects.description: At the Zaanstad municipality I realized an IT policy document. The IT policy document was based on architectural principles that were formulated in accordance with the first phase in TOGAF 9 (called preliminary phase). This framework is based on Enterprise Architecture / Business - IT alignment. As a result, the framework is used to form better arguments when choosing IT components (throughout different layers from Business to IT applications and IT infrastructure). The IT Policy document contributed to a better alignment between the primary organization and IT. The document serves the CIO to make decisions with regards to IT infrastructure components, but from an organizational standpoint. During the assignment I applied a modified version of the demand-supply model of Prof. Dr. Rik Maes.

projects.title: Agile Practitioner at ING Bank
projects.description:
SCRUM (Agile) specialist for ING Bank. •	At the ING bank (within the mortgage department) I was part of a project team of 15 people who worked according to the agile/SCRUM methodology. SCRUM is a methodology which follows the LEAN philosophy.  I was responsible for the quality of the application and process. I communicated with different disciplines within the application development team and even took over / adopted parts of their tasks when necessary (this is required when applying SCRUM). At a later stage during the project I coordinated two test engineers and acquired a central position with regards to the flow of communication.

For this assignment I increased my knowledge of Agile / SCRUM testing as well as mortgages, in particular the sales process. In a multifunctional team I worked closely with business / requirements analysts and developers as quality gatekeeper. I was mainly responsible for the quality of the system and support business analysts in reviewing business requirements.The main goal was to implement a CRM application based on Microsoft Dynamics. 

• Functional acceptance testing
• Quality Assurance
• Reviewing and providing feedback on stakeholder requests / business requirements
• HP Quality Center
• Microsoft Excel
• Microsoft Dynamics CRM
• SQL Server Management Studio

projects.title: Consultant at Huawei in Shenzhen (China)
projects.description:
At Huawei, a large multinational telecom provider based in Shenzhen (China), I conducted a process improvement assignment on site at the client’s Chinese headquarters alongside the writer of the TPI maturity matrix book. TPI is a consultancy method in order to establish the maturity of processes (within software development departments). The goal for this assignment was to improve the organisational processes within Huawei’s application development department by conducting an analysis on the current situation (interviews, documentation studies) and providing advice on improvement. Major findings were that Huawei could improve the application of agile / SCRUM within the entire department. During this project I conducted interviews, wrote large parts of the report and adopted the TPI maturity matrix methodology. Huawei, as well as Sogeti were satisfied with the results. My tasks during this period were:

• Interviews + documentation to establish the current test process
• Provide consultation concerning TMap Next and TPI Next
• Consultation about automated testing and Agile /SCRUM
• Provide training to local employees in test design techniques (according to TMap)
• Review and co-write the final report which was prepared for management

By using the TPI methodology, we gained insight in the maturity of the process. Results and recommendations were made to improve the process maturity.

projects.title: Quality Engineer at KPN
projects.description:
• Model Based Reviewing
• Model Based Testing
• Functional Design

Ahmad's main responsibility was to translate testscripts into funtional flows. These models were used to explain the transfer of data between different systems with their status.

projects.title: Test & Quality Engineer at KNLTB
projects.description:
Involved in the world's largest CRM implementation project for a major Dutch sports organisation.

• Structured testing, using SQL server Management Studio
• SQL queries
• Analysis in Excel
• Testing and analysis with Microsoft Dynamics CRM

projects.title: Consultant at Ahold
projects.description: Together with a team of four consultants I conducted an audit assignment for Ahold HR Services Europe with regards to a failed project. When we arrived the project at Ahold already failed and the contract with the service provider was eventually terminated. In 2009, Ahold HR Services initiated an HR transformation project (HR business process outsourcing) up until 2012 when the contract was terminated. We were asked to prepare a lessons learned report to review the entire process from the beginning until the termination of the contract in order to gain an objective view on what went wrong. Four streams were identified for the analysis: Selection phase, Contracting phase, Transition phase and HR processes. Experts on these streams each wrote their analysis in order to identify the different obstacles that Ahold faced. My role was to coordinate the project process and to obtain an overview on these four streams. I conducted interviews along with the experts, wrote interview reports and worked on the final report which was presented to the HR Director Europe.

projects.title: IT Strategy Consultant at Deli XL
projects.description: Deli XL is a well-known middle sized Dutch organisation in the food- and beverage branch. At Deli XL I prepared the IT strategy for their IT landscape. In short, this implies that I, together with another consultant, conducted an analysis on the current situation by means of interviews and documentation studies. On the basis of the obtained information we defined so called ‘Service Towers’ where we identified and distinguished core- and non-core activities (along with a financial analysis that I prepared in Excel). The results and recommendations were processed in a final report which was presented to the CEO and CIO. The main challenge for this assignment was to determine the impact of the change with regards to the IT landscape in relation with the rest of the organisation.

projects.title: IT Strategy Consultant at RAET
projects.description: RAET is a Dutch company that specialises in the automation of payroll and personnel management. I have done an assignment to offer a second opinion concerning their existing sourcing strategy. The existing sourcing strategy suggested to outsource RAET’s .NET capabilities to Indian service providers. My role within a project team of three members was to focus on questions with regards to supplier profiles and intercultural management. I prepared an analysis in PowerPoint with different service provider profiles (highlighting pros, cons, certifications, etc.) and wrote parts of the reports with regards to intercultural management.

projects.title: Outsourcing Advisor at Adecco and NS
projects.description: Adecco is an HR and recruitment company that operates in more than 60 countries world-wide. I was involved in the supplier selection process as an advisor. During this process I gathered information from different suppliers (RFI / RFP) and analysed the information that was returned. Based on the information I wrote a recommendation report. I did a similar assignment at NS (the principle passenger railway operator in the Netherlands).

publications.name: ‘Employer Branding and EVP; a comparitive study between Dutch and Chinese students'

profile_positions.description:
• responsible for requirements and demand management to prepare the organisation for (possible) procurement.
• Supplier Management; expertise of IT (software) related products in the market; including contact with the market.

profile_positions.title: Demand Manager

profile_positions.description:
• Demand Management: I am acceptant of newly developed applications. In charge of high level acceptance criteria and requirements management.
• Quality management - I analyse processes, create advisory products and propose solutions.
• Advisory: I evaluate damages (major incidents with an external impact) and propose solutions to prevent them. The goal is process optimisation on different levels.
• Contract and SLA management: understanding services delivered and document agreements with other parties.
• Customer-focus; this implies a focus on end-to-end service delivery and everything in between (cross-departmental).
profile_positions.title: Service Manager

profile_positions.description:
My position was two-fold:
• Service Level Management: I created the SLA- and also the OLA documents in the English language. These documents are the result of coordination and documentation of business processes that affect Customer Success and other departments. For this, I communicated with stakeholders from different departments as well as our Legal partner. The documents focus on customer success/customer satisfaction (I am also responsible for quality service review meetings and other customer engagement activities). This role requires a great deal of stakeholder management and coordination with customers and also with departments internally;
• Escalation management: external communication and project management, mainly for the larger accounts (for example multinationals). I managed customer communication on top and middle management, as well as user and technical level - which required T model thinking (switching from helicopter view to details and back to helicopter view). Escalations are mainly disruptions to daily work, which have a major impact on the customer organisation. An escalation often had an underlying cause that was unknown. The course sometimes was within the customer’s organisation. I facilitated the thinking process by applying the law of elimination (eliminate potential causes) to conclude with the right solution, fitted to the situation and customer. I managed the implementation of solutions via cross functional teams and ensured that actions were followed up.

Onguard is currently a part of Visma.
profile_positions.title: Service Delivery and Escalation Manager

profile_positions.description:
• Within this role I applied Prince2 and managed projects, where I was responsible for:
  - Project Management, 
  - Blueprint/requirements management and workshops, 
  - Training end-users and adoption methods,
  - Test support, 
  - Go-live support, aftercare & service delivery transfer to the service desk.
• For larger projects, I did end-to-end Project Management and Business Consultancy. I also regularly supported Account Management from a pre-sales perspective, before a project was signed. The projects varied in size; from small companies to large multinationals. I was responsible for the implementation of two applications:
  - CreditManager: a tool for the dunning process, after invoices are overdue;
  - MatchMaker: a tool for reconciliation (matching open payments with invoices).
profile_positions.title: Project Manager / Consultant

profile_positions.description:
At KPN Consulting I worked in a diverse atmosphere and with a wide range of responsibilities. I worked on assignments that range from Enterprise Architecture to project management to process management. I usually focused on IT projects from a business standpoint. To narrow down my expertise, you may find a list of key words:

• Business (Process) Consultant
• Government & Education 
• Management Consulting
• Operational Excellence
• Process Management
• Lean Six Sigma (L6S)
• Kaizen
• Business - IT alignment
• IT strategy
• Enterprise architecture
• TOGAF
• Governance / IT policy

KPN Consulting is currently a part of Cegeka.
profile_positions.title: Process Consultant

company.name: KPMG Shared Services and Outsourcing Advisory

profile_positions.description:
During the time as management consultant at KPMG, Ahmad provided advisory services with regards to Shared Services and Outsourcing. Below you may find a list of project were Ahmad was involved in:
• Sourcing strategy: usually for ITO (Infrastructure or IT Outsourcing) Ahmad worked with a team of consultants for famous Dutch organisations. In general, this implies that Ahmad did an analysis on the current IT landscape by conducting interviews and documentation studies. On the basis of the obtained information so called ‘Service Towers’ where we identified and distinguished core- and non core activities (along with a financial analysis that Ahmad prepared in Excel). Main challenges for sourcing strategy assignments were to determine the impact of the change of the IT landscape in relation with the rest of the organisation. Overcoming business and IT alignment puzzles were essential to overcome these challenges. 
• IT audits and project management: for a failed BPO (Business Process Outsourcing) at a famous international client in the supermarket industry, Ahmad conducted an audit assignment together with a team of four consultants. A lessons learned report to review the entire process from the beginning until the termination of the contract was the end result for this assignment in order for the client to gain an objective view on what went wrong (and in which ‘stream’ or parts of the project the problems lie).

• Management Consulting
• Global Sourcing Advisory
• Shared Services and Outsourcing Advisory
• Strategic Sourcing Management
• Strategy and Selection Advisory
• Market Analysis
• Outsourcing business case
• Outsourcing implementation
• Vendor Management
• Benchmarking
• Contract analysis
• SLA analysis
• Sourcing Strategy
• Tender selection
• Service Provider evaluations
• Contract management
• BPO/ITO
• Governance, Solutions
• high level Benchmarks
• Cost Price / financial analysis
• Service Tower analysis
• Intercultural Management
